description: A basic binary raster image file format, used for aerial photography and spectral data. The BIP file is a binary file of raw data that requires additional information, usually represented in an associated ASCII file, to be interpreted correctly.
name: Band Interleaved by Pixel (BIP) Image File
extras: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><metadata><field name="disclosure">Is open format.</field><field name="filenameExtension">bip</field><field name="internetMediaType"></field><field name="pronomPUID"></field></metadata>
